bug.author: zeal-github
bug.description:
Thanks for your jobs. The README file is detailedã€‚ However, in generate_data_human.py, there exist one file I can't find. <denchmark-code>mesh_ref = pymesh.load_mesh("/home/thibault/Downloads/MPI-FAUST/training/ref/reg_color_ref.ply") </denchmark-code>
I have download MPI-FAUST dataset, but the sub-directory [training] has no directory named [ref]. Also, it seems that the MPI-FAUST dataset you used is different from what I download from the website. Do you sure that you download the FAUST dataset from <denchmark-link:http://faust.is.tue.mpg.de/challenge/Inter-subject_challenge>http://faust.is.tue.mpg.de/challenge/Inter-subject_challenge</denchmark-link> . And you have no further process?

comments.comment:
Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/zeal-github>@zeal-github</denchmark-link>
Thanks for pointing this out. reg_color_ref is just the first training example of FAUST; centered and colorized. I've included it in template/template_color.ply. You can git pull. Best regards, Thibault

<denchmark-link:https://github.com/ThibaultGROUEIX>@ThibaultGROUEIX</denchmark-link> Thanks for your reply. I can't create a conda env using this file . Conda put out a error <denchmark-code> ValueError: Incompatible component merge: - '0' - 'h1d4fec5_0' </denchmark-code>
I don't know why. My configuration: system: ubuntu 14/16 conda: ananconda3 I just want to make sure that the .yml file is latest.
Yes, you're wright, there was a weird issue. I commited an update of the list of dependencies and ran a clean install. it worked for me. Best regards, Thibault
